verses.plain: Blessed be the LORD my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:

tokens.t: Blessed
the
my strength, which teacheth my hands to war,
my fingers to fight:

verses.plain: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

tokens.t: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and
in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

verses.plain: LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

tokens.t: , what
man, that thou takest knowledge of him!
the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

verses.plain: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

tokens.t: Man is like to vanity: his days
as a shadow that passeth away.

verses.plain: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

tokens.t: Bow thy heavens, O
, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

verses.plain: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

tokens.t: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

verses.plain: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

tokens.t: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

verses.plain: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

tokens.t: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand
a right hand of falsehood.

verses.plain: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

tokens.t: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery
an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

verses.plain: It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

tokens.t: that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

verses.plain: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:

tokens.t: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand
a right hand of falsehood:

verses.plain: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:

tokens.t: That our sons
as plants grown up in their youth;
our daughters
as corner stones, polished
the similitude of a palace:

verses.plain: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

tokens.t: our garners
full, affording all manner of store:
our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

verses.plain: That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.

tokens.t: our oxen
strong to labour;
no breaking in, nor going out; that
no complaining in our streets.

verses.plain: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the LORD.

tokens.t: Happy
people, that is in such a case:
, happy
people, whose God
the

footnotes.text: to war…: Heb. to the war, etc
all…: Heb. from kind to kind
strong…: Heb. able to bear burdens, or, loaden with flesh
